remarks: Existential uniqueness "picks" a variable value for which another wff is true.  If there is only one thing ` x ` such that ` ph ` is true, and there is also an ` x ` (actually the same one) such that ` ph ` and ` ps ` are both true, then ` ph ` implies ` ps ` regardless of ` x ` .  This theorem can be useful for eliminating existential quantifiers in a hypothesis.  Compare Theorem *14.26 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 192. (Contributed by NM, 10-Jul-1994.)
statement: eupick $p |- ( ( E! x ph /\ E. x ( ph /\ ps ) ) -> ( ph -> ps ) ) $.
